content.description: 2) Seth project  (see beta photo) This shares the same start as king tut but goes straight up to the left from the crimp shelf and uses only the really bad crimps and bad slopy left-hand pinch.
Start on the crimp shelf and go up left. There is a nice bicycle with your feet to get the second shale ledge that will keep the move static if you wish.

1) King Tut's Tomb (beta photo) A great line starting on a quartzite ball jug. Liftoff the ground and go right to a crimp shelf. hand-foot match and reach right to another nice jug. This is a reach for some so might be dynamic but satisfying. heel around the boulder to reach left to the next shelf. Then bicycle your feet on the crimp shelf on the outside toe hooking the corner just behind the shelf. This will allow tension to reach left to the next sharp but big self. top out left from there.
content.location: Walk past warm-up to The Lost Crag, continue to Coffin Boulder. The cave is just past this. you may need to walk down into the valley a bit to spot it. The route starts on the quartzite ball jug deep in the cave.

content.description: A fun short arḗte. The crux is getting out of the start.

The boulder has a very steep roof that houses a few moderate climbs and one project featuring some nice quartzite and slate. It's pretty chossy as of yet though I would think after some people climb on it lots of the small loose chunks will fall off. This is a lowball boulder, though it takes 3/5 moves to get out of the cave onto a 45' roof.
